page.title: 02LIMERIGG CROFTING 1
page.content: In the 12 sq.km.surrounding Limerigg village,there are 5 farms,one of which is more appropriately called a croft because it is less than 60 acres. The croft is called Holehousemuir and is owned by Mr and Mrs Kay. They and their handicapped son have lived there since 1951. It is mostly Mrs Kay who works the croft. In years gone by,she kept dairy cows and sold their milk sometimes in form of cheese. However when the pasteurization laws came into force she decided to concentrate on beef cattle. Nowadays,her 35 acres are mainly used as pasture for her 20 beef cattle and some calves. She also keeps 2 cockerels a few bantams,and some dogs and cats. She works long hours each day,tending to the needs of the cattle,her family and the general running of the croft.
